result.execSummary:
The defendant Dah L Loo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 6, consecutive to 21CF5120.

AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dah L Loo

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING (34 pages) commencing 05-31-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Dah L Loo in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Dah L Loo in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sworn as interpreter: Earnest Pyaohn

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 6, 7: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Counts 8, 9: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charges dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 6: Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 7, consecutive to 21CF5120, credit of 131 days time served.

As to Count 7:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 1/2 years, concurrent to Count 6, consecutive to 21CF5120, credit of 131 days time served, the term of initial confinement is 1 1/2 years, the term of extended supervision is 2 years. 

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with co actors. 
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA,  out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Plea Addendum

1481 Jury Instruction

400 jury instruction

1795 jury instruction

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Dah L Loo not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Dah L Loo not in court, in custody.  Allysa Brown for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On defense request to adjourn the 3/23/2022 scheduling conference, court rescheduled the scheduling conference in Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Adjourn, filed by defense

Defendant Dah L Loo in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Dah L Loo in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Priscilla Patrick Aung. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Court took judicial notice of Waukesha case 21CF1720 & Milwaukee case 21CF5120. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective D. Madden. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dah L Loo not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Lah Wah was present by video.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Kuehn is in trial in another court on another matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Sworn as KAREN interpreter: Prescilla Aungy

Defendant Dah L Loo in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Dah L Loo in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dah L Loo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 6 and 9.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
